DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Histologic Feature Height Dimension Centimeter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The height of a biospecimen in centimeters.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions:Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues:A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest_The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension:The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions:Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues:A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
A prominent or identifiable aspect, region, or site of interest.

Property.preferredDefinition: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension:The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height

Concepts.definition: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/28/17 changed context from Test to EDRN. jk 2018-07-11 RR: Added a conceptual domain and changed the workflow status to "Released", added a registration status

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Records the measurement results in centimeters.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A centimeter is a basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Concepts.definition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2021-9-27 ak Txfr EDRN VD to DCP due to reuse. Modified VD per ws. AK 2/14/17 2017-03-07 RR: Added cm as a unit of measure 2018-07-11 RR: Changed the conceptual domain from "Assessment Results" to "Property", added a max length of 3, changed the workflow status to "Released", added a registration status

DataElement.changeDescription: 2017-03-07 RR: Added preferred question text 2018-07-11 RR: Saved the existing definition as an alternate definition and modified the preferred definition, changed the workflow status to "Released."
